attributes.action: Peoples vote for no confidence in this Governments Prime minister: Cameron
attributes.additional_details: This Government has pushed through many laws and new policies without debate and thorough consultation. This Government has 'backtracked' several times with regards to their manifesto.  David Cameron announced before the GE that he would not Touch Tax Credits, yet pushed through cuts that were not properly debated. Therefore, there is a lack of confidence in this Government that reflects a lack of interest in the people of the U.K. and a greater demonstration of their own self interest
attributes.background: Debate in Parliament for more transparency to any new policies in law due to lack of public confidence in the present UK Government

rejection.details:
We're not sure whether you want a public vote on whether people have confidence in the Prime Minister, a debate in Parliament about transparency in Government, or something else.

You could start a new petition asking clearly for the specific action you want the Government or Parliament to take.
